description:
Xiphophorus hellerii, commonly known as the green swordtail, is a species of freshwater fish that belongs to the family Poeciliidae. It is native to the Atlantic slope of southern Mexico and northern Central America, including parts of Belize, Guatemala, and Honduras.

The green swordtail is a small, live-bearing fish that typically grows to a length of around 6-8 inches (15-20 cm). It is characterized by its distinctive swordlike extension of the lower caudal fin in male individuals, which can be up to half the length of the body. The body coloration of the green swordtail can vary, ranging from various shades of green, yellow, and orange, with some individuals also displaying patterns or spots.

These fish are popular in the aquarium trade and are known for their hardy nature, adaptability to a range of water conditions, and their vibrant coloration. They are omnivorous, feeding on a variety of plant and animal matter, and are often used in biological research, particularly in the study of sexual selection and the evolution of secondary sexual characteristics.
